title: epi2me-labs/wf-teloseq
description: A workflow to analyse telomere-enriched data generated using Oxford Nanoporeâ€™s Telo-Seq method.

input.title: Input Options
input.description: Parameters for finding and handling input data for analysis.

fastq.title: FASTQ
fastq.description: FASTQ files to use in the analysis.
fastq.help_text: This accepts one of three cases: (i) the path to a single FASTQ file; (ii) the path to a top-level directory containing FASTQ files; (iii) the path to a directory containing one level of sub-directories which in turn contain FASTQ files. In the first and second case, a sample name can be supplied with `--sample`. In the last case, the data is assumed to be multiplexed with the names of the sub-directories as barcodes. In this case, a sample sheet can be provided with `--sample_sheet`.

bam.description: BAM or unaligned BAM (uBAM) files to use in the analysis.
bam.help_text: This accepts one of three cases: (i) the path to a single BAM file; (ii) the path to a top-level directory containing BAM files; (iii) the path to a directory containing one level of sub-directories which in turn contain BAM files. In the first and second case, a sample name can be supplied with `--sample`. In the last case, the data is assumed to be multiplexed with the names of the sub-directories as barcodes. In this case, a sample sheet can be provided with `--sample_sheet`.

analyse_unclassified.title: Analyse unclassified reads
analyse_unclassified.description: Analyse unclassified reads from input directory. By default the workflow will not process reads in the unclassified directory.
analyse_unclassified.help_text: If selected and if the input is a multiplex directory the workflow will also process the unclassified directory.

reference.description: Reference genome of the sequenced sample.

samples.title: Sample Options
samples.description: Parameters that relate to samples such as sample sheets and sample names.

sample_sheet.description: A CSV file used to map barcodes to sample aliases. The sample sheet can be provided when the input data is a directory containing sub-directories with FASTQ files.
sample_sheet.help_text: The sample sheet is a CSV file with, minimally, columns named `barcode` and `alias`. Extra columns are allowed. A `type` column is required for certain workflows and should have the following values; `test_sample`, `positive_control`, `negative_control`, `no_template_control`.

sample.description: A single sample name for non-multiplexed data. Permissible if passing a single .FASTQ(.gz) file or directory of .FASTQ(.gz) files.

mapping.description: Perform alignment to assign haplotypes to telomeric reads.
mapping.help_text: If selected the workflow will perform alignment to a provided reference or to the default HG002 based reference, allowing statistics to be resolved to the contig or haplotype level.  Apply `--mapping false` if there is no suitable reference available. This will generate statistics for reads with detected telomeric repeats, but will not assign haplotypes. If the reference is kept to only telomeric and subtelomeric regions, alignment should not add significant overhead.

alignment_threads.description: Set max number of threads to use for alignment.

output.title: Output Options
output.description: Parameters for saving and naming workflow outputs.

out_dir.description: Directory for output of all workflow results.

advanced_options.title: Advanced Options
advanced_options.description: Advanced options for configuring processes inside the workflow.
advanced_options.help_text: These advanced options do not need to be changed for typical use, but allow fine tuning of workflows for users who want more control over the workflow.

mapq.help_text: Alignments to the reference with a mapping quality (MAPQ) score lower than this value will be discarded from further processing.

min_length.help_text: Used in initial filtering of reads. This removes all reads which are either noise, artifacts or partial, and which cannot be full telomeric sequences. Setting this number too high runs the risk of artificially inflating calculated telomere lengths.

read_quality.description: Reads with a mean quality score lower than this value will be filtered out prior to analysis.

restriction_site.help_text: Restriction enzyme cut site used for filtering reads that are not close to this site for the strict setting

beyond_cut.description: Amount of reference to include beyond cut site for each contig

telomere_extension.description: Addition of telomere to reference avoid mismapping
telomere_extension.help_text: Reads primary and secondary alignments can be incorrect if one similar reference contig has longer telomere that allows read to match to it better than the other contig

telomere_margin.description: Distance from telomere boundary to use to remove reads whose 3' end do not map up to this chromosome position.

disable_ping.description: Enable to prevent sending a workflow ping.
